episodes.title: Sedna FM #01 - November Bomb
episodes.description: The first Family & Friends radio episode from Yasmin Sarbaoui and Gaia Parolini. Where it all began — a life soundtrack that launched Sedna FM into the universe. Raw, heartfelt, and full of the energy that defines everything that followed.
songs: Canserbero - De la vida como pelicula, tragedia, comedia y ficcion

episodes.title: Sedna FM #02 - Destination Sedna
episodes.description: Continuing the Sedna FM journey together with family and friends! Episode two of the main series — exploring new musical territories and deepening the connection with our listeners. A collective voyage through sound.
songs: Odion Iruoje - Identify With Your Roots
Depeche mode - world in my eyes (Oil Tank Mix)

episodes.title: Sedna FM #03 - Beautiful as You Feel
episodes.description: An episode about self-acceptance and inner beauty. Music that reminds us we are beautiful as we feel, embracing our authentic selves. Warm, uplifting sounds that celebrate individuality.
songs: The The - this is the day
DCTL - Deep Tannin f(eat Rafael Leafar)

episodes.title: Sedna FM #04 - Queen of Spades
episodes.description: Tuning in from the planet of irrational love. Exploring love's most vulnerable side — the kind that awakens the child within us. A diverse music selection ranging from electric blues to downtempo, soul, and jazz. A tribute to the feeling that has moved artists to create the most beautiful works. Love makes us vulnerable, and there is no art without vulnerability.
songs: Alabama Shakes - Gimme All Your Love
Queens of the stone age - Make it wit chu
Etta James - I'd Rather Go Blind
Eric Clapton - Have you ever loved a woman

episodes.title: Sedna FM #05 - On The Go - Zero Zero
episodes.description: An energetic mix for when you're on the move. Zero Zero captures that feeling of starting fresh, moving forward, and embracing the journey. Perfect for travel, walks, or just getting things done.
songs: Grace Jones - Pull up to the bumper
Easy star all star - Soul love
James Brown - Talking loud and saying nothing (remix)

episodes.title: Sedna FM #06 - Alters of an Ego
episodes.description: What if you could step outside yourself and become someone freer, bolder, or completely unexpected? Exploring the artistry of musicians who craft alter-egos and parallel realities to experiment with new dimensions of their identity. It's not about hiding who they are — it's about expanding who they can be.
songs: The Fireman - Strawberries Oceans Ships Forest

episodes.title: Morning Drops #01 - Timeless Legacy
episodes.description: Gaia guides us through timeless music to start the morning with the right foot! The first episode of the Morning Drops series — classic sounds that never fade.
songs: Roberta Flack - Killing me softly with his song

episodes.title: Morning Drops #02 - Waves of the Maghreb
episodes.description: Oriental vibes guided by Yasmin. Discovering curious facts about the Maghreb, together with its fascinating music! A wonderful trip with a selection of songs from North Africa.
songs: Nass El Ghiwane - El Madi Fate

episodes.title: Morning Drops #03 - Space Shift
episodes.description: Gaia invites you to shift your mindset with a simple yet powerful reflection: What if we saw emptiness not as a void but as space to create? An energising and feel-good selection of tracks, the perfect way to ease into your day and set the tone for the week ahead.
songs: Willy J Healey - Woke Up Smiling
The Strokes - You Only Live Once

episodes.title: Morning Drops #04 - Bars With Balls
episodes.description: Yasmin dives into Women's Day through the voices of four incredible female rappers. Morning fire from the magic planet of Sedna FM — move your hands up and down with us. Hip hop culture through a feminine lens.
songs: Little Simz - Point and Kill (feat. Obongjayar)

episodes.title: Morning Drops #05 - Electric Shock
episodes.description: An energizing episode with electrifying sounds to wake you up and get you moving. High energy tracks that deliver a jolt of musical electricity to start your day.

episodes.title: Morning Drops #06 - Friend's Home
episodes.description: Yasmin and Gaia are reunited under the same roof to spend Easter Monday morning together, exploring that heartwarming 'just like home' feeling that comes from being surrounded by beloved friends.

episodes.title: Morning Drops #07 - secret_mp3_player_1
episodes.description: Inspired by a throwback MP3 player on Instagram, Yasmin and Gaia take you on a nostalgic journey to the early 2000s. LimeWire, eMule, guilty-pleasure playlists — remember those? Hit play and relive the songs that shaped a generation.

episodes.title: Morning Drops #08 - (un)Boxing
episodes.description: An episode about breaking free from expectations and labels. Music that helps us unbox ourselves and embrace who we truly are.
songs: Kendrick Lamar - The Blacker the Berry

episodes.title: Morning Drops #09 - Birthday Cake
episodes.description: Today's breakfast comes with a sprinkle of stardust and a slice of birthday cake as we celebrate a pure and unique soul, Yasmin. On Sedna, we may not do years, but we sure know how to party!

episodes.title: Morning Drops #10 - The One With Many Names
episodes.description: Yasmin guides us through the glamorous world of Ghost, the Swedish band that turned rock into ritual. From masked clergy to shifting identities, diving into the music and myth of one of the most theatrical acts of our time.

episodes.title: Morning Drops #11 - Mediterranean Boat
episodes.description: Gaia invites you to embark on a musical voyage across the Mediterranean. Exploring music from different countries shared by people who call them home. A warm, sun-soaked journey through coastal sounds.
songs: Fabrizio De André - Crêuza de mä

episodes.title: Morning Drops #12 - 80's Club
episodes.description: Starting with a Monday evening in Munich — a few drinks, friends, and landing in an 80s dance party. From Donna Summer's hypnotic pulse, to Depeche Mode's bright synthpop, Ken Laszlo's Italo Disco romance, and Mylène Farmer's darker theatrical world. Four songs, four corners of the 80s — connected by the machines that changed how we dance.
songs: Depeche Mode - Just Can't Get Enough

episodes.title: Morning Drops #13 - Demystifying Reggaeton
episodes.description: Yasmin takes us on a journey through the real story of reggaeton — from its roots in Panama and Puerto Rico to its global evolution. Exploring the genre's history, influences, and cultural impact.
songs: Renato - Chica de los Ojos Café
B. F. Yaviah - Si Tu Quieres Fumar

episodes.title: Morning Drops #14 - Slow Planet
episodes.description: A pause. A quiet return to slower rhythms, sparked by a live set under the summer sky. A moment to breathe and settle into the week.

episodes.title: Morning Drops #15 - Unfreezing
episodes.description: A short, honest Morning Drop with no grand theme — just four tracks, a bit of voice, and the decision to not wait for the 'right' moment. Room to breathe today.
songs: Jane Birkin & Serge Gainsbourg - Je t’aime… moi non plus
Bernard Badie - In Love (DJ Quad's at Night Mix)

episodes.title: Morning Drops #16 - The Sound of Tuareg
episodes.description: A journey into the sound of the Tuareg: from traditional chants and desert rituals to the electrified rhythms of exile and resistance. Music shaped by sand, memory, and survival.

episodes.title: Morning Drops #17 - Steel City
episodes.description: Gaia takes us on a short trip through Sheffield's sounds — from electronic textures to raw guitars and sharp storytelling. Four tracks, one city, different edges of the same story.
songs: The Human League - The Sound Of The Crowd

episodes.title: Morning Drops #18 - Sardegna
episodes.description: Yasmin traces her connection to Sardegna — the island where her Italian journey began. Through music and memory, she shares the story of how this place shaped her family's path, and why it still holds such a deep place in her heart.
songs: Mahmood & Tenores di Bitti - Com’è profondo il mare

episodes.title: Morning Drops #20 - Hitchhiking Poland
episodes.description: Yasmin takes you back to the summer of 2020, when borders were still uncertain and a long-held wish to visit Poland finally came true. Through four tracks, tracing her journey from a stranger's couch in Poznań to the peaks of Zakopane.

episodes.title: Morning Drops #21 - Endless Summer
episodes.description: Recorded from Fano, a quiet town on the Adriatic coast where summer stretches long and slow. Between swims, simple meals, and time with family, Gaia reflects on the kind of music that helps us return to ourselves. Through different shades of jazz — from minimal and meditative to warm and rhythmic — an invitation to slip into that endless summer feeling.

episodes.title: Morning Drops #22 - Sicilians On The Dolomites
episodes.description: Hosted by Yasmin, a musical journey inspired by the mountains. Joined by two special guests, exploring the tracks they've chosen, hearing the stories behind their picks, and discovering the personal memories each song brings to life — a blend of music, voices, and landscapes you can hear.
songs: Florian Pellissier Quintet - Coup de foudre à Thessalonique
Lucio Dalla & Francesco De Gregori - Ma come fanno i marinai

episodes.title: Morning Drops #23 - Morning Dubs
episodes.description: Recorded while still processing Houghton Festival. One of the mornings there, waking up in the woods to a reggae DJ set — no phone signal, just trees, music, and loved ones. A slow selection of reggae, dub, and morning rhythms. Dubs instead of drops. Start your day slow — with space to breathe.
songs: The Gaylads - Joy in the Morning
King Tubby - King Tubby Meets the Rockers Uptown

episodes.title: Morning Drops #24 - The Rise Of Afrobeat
episodes.description: An exploration of the rise of Afrobeat, tracing its roots and evolution as a genre that blends African rhythms with jazz, funk, and highlife. A celebration of the infectious energy and cultural significance of this influential musical movement.

episodes.title: Morning Drops #25 - A Trip-Hop Journey
episodes.description: Hosted by friend Lorenzo, a journey through the roots and evolution of trip-hop. From Bristol's early experiments with Massive Attack and Tricky, to DJ Shadow's cinematic sampling in California, and Thievery Corporation's global downtempo grooves in Washington D.C. — exploring how this genre blurred boundaries and reshaped electronic music.
songs: Tricky - Hell Is Round the Corner
DJ Shadow - Midnight in a Perfect World

episodes.title: Morning Drops #26 - Canserbero
episodes.description: Yasmin guides us through the story of Canserbero, the Venezuelan rapper who reshaped Latin American hip hop with his raw voice and deeply reflective lyrics. A journey into his music, his vision, and the legacy of an artist who transformed personal and social struggles into powerful storytelling.
songs: Canserbero - De la vida como una película y su tragedia, comedia y ficción

episodes.title: Morning Drops #27 - Nomophobia
episodes.description: Yasmin reflects on what happened when she recently lost her phone and why it felt freeing. A dive into the psychology of our relationship with smartphones: from nomophobia (the fear of being without a phone), to digital burnout and cognitive overload, to the surprising benefits of boredom and the brain's default mode network. An invitation to rethink how we connect and disconnect.

episodes.title: Morning Drops #28 - Under Scottish Skies
episodes.description: Gaia shares a personal moment of transition — a shift in seasons, in rhythm, and in life. From this space of quiet change comes a musical journey through Scotland: not the usual names, but voices that speak from the edges. A personal ritual and a small act of curiosity: an invitation to notice what grounds us when everything moves.
songs: Paolo Nutini - Pencil Full of Lead

episodes.title: Morning Drops #29 - Berber France Meets Arabic Italy
episodes.description: Yasmin takes us back to her university years, where she met Abdel - an Algerian-French friend with a big heart and endless optimism. Their friendship grew around music, identity, and playful arguments about whether a song was originally Italian or French. Music that exists in both versions, alongside stories of finding a home, boxing training, and car rides filled with music.

episodes.title: Morning Drops #30 - Star Treatment
episodes.description: A celebration of change and transformation. Gaia traces the evolution of Arctic Monkeys - from raw energy to cinematic sound - reflecting on how artists, and all of us, grow and change through time. A journey through courage, curiosity, and the beauty of slowing down.
songs: Arctic Monkeys - There’d Better Be a Mirrorball

episodes.title: Morning Drops #31 - Sailing With Germans
episodes.description: From the deck of a sailing boat, hosted by Yasmin and her special guests. A week at sea with six Germans, each with their own stories, songs, and ways of moving through the waves. From shared meals to unexpected laughter, from quiet resilience to sun-soaked joy — a collection of voices and tracks that reflect what it means to journey together.
songs: Ben Howard - Keep Your Head Up

episodes.title: Morning Drops #32 - A Weekend In London
episodes.description: Recorded in London, marking a weekend reunion between Gaia and Yasmin. A selection inspired by London's energy, seen through the eyes of two inseparable friends — music from concerts, club nights, and long walks across town. Four tracks to ease you into the week at the right pace.
songs: Jimmy Castor Bunch - It's Just Begun
The Asphodells - Late Flowering Lust (Phil Kieran Remix)

episodes.title: Morning Drops #33 - Immerse
episodes.description: An analogy between diving, one of Gaia's great passions, and the act of immersing in life itself. A reflection on what happens when we go below the surface: when we let ourselves be fully present. From moments of calm suspension to warm, rhythmic flow, the selection moves like water — fluid, organic, and alive. An invitation to slow down, listen deeper, and float.
songs: Pino D'Angiò - Un Po' d'Uva e un Liquore

episodes.title: Morning Drops #34 - Soul Sisters
episodes.description: A tribute to four iconic voices — women who have shaped the way we listen, feel, and move. Each track carries a different kind of presence: one that holds you, one that questions, one that grounds, and one that lets go. An energy that is soulful, raw, and unapologetically feminine.
songs: Grace Jones - Walking in the Rain
Aretha Franklin - A Rose Is Still a Rose

episodes.title: Morning Drops #35 - Thailand
episodes.description: Recorded in Koh Samui, Thailand, where Yasmin and her friend Patricia spent more than two intense weeks training Muay Thai and Western boxing. Between sweat, rhythm, and sea breeze, they share reflections on discipline, friendship, and the beauty of movement - with a soundtrack that connects Thai sounds to the flow of daily practice.
songs: Burna Boy - Cheat on Me (feat. Dave)

episodes.title: Morning Drops #36 - Women of Rock
episodes.description: A tribute to the women who shaped the sound of rock, the ones who picked up a guitar and refused to ask for permission. The conversation unfolds in Italian, led by Gaia and her father. A dialogue between generations and a reminder that the pulse of rock has always belonged to anyone brave enough to play it loud. Distortion, rhythm, freedom.
songs: Joan Jett & The Blackhearts - I Love Rock 'n Roll

episodes.title: Morning Drops #37 - Happy Birthday Gaia
episodes.description: A special Morning Drop to celebrate Gaia's birthday and the first anniversary of Sedna FM. A journey through friendship, music, and voice messages from the people who've known her longest. From street dance classes in Milan to creative adventures in London, a tribute to growing up together and showing up for each other.
songs: The Mighty Tiny & The Many Few - Good Foot

episodes.title: Morning Drops #38 - History of Flamenco
episodes.description: A special journey into the history of Flamenco, guided by Yasmin and her guest Almudena from Madrid, Spain. Exploring the roots and evolution of this emotionally raw and culturally rich tradition, from its early vocal origins and Andalusian influences, through its transformation on stage and screen, to its modern reinventions by iconic Spanish artists.
songs: La Niña de los Peines - Al Gurugú
Paco de Lucía - Entre dos aguas
Camarón de la Isla - La leyenda del tiempo

episodes.title: Morning Drops #39 - Moving Meditation
episodes.description: An episode inspired by how travel helps us see more clearly. Stepping into new places opens the mind, shifts perspective. The music moves through balearic warmth, boogie grooves, world and latin-folk influences, and touches of new wave — a selection built to follow the quiet changes that happen when you're out of your usual rhythm.
songs: España Circo Este - Dormo poco e sogno molto
Talking Heads - This Must Be the Place (Naive Melody)

episodes.title: Morning Drops #40 - Diving With Orcas
episodes.description: Yasmin's friend Caroline takes us beyond the polar circle, into the Arctic waters of Norway, where orcas and humpback whales gather each winter. A personal journey shaped by a quiet obsession with orcas, from Patagonia to the icy fjords of the north. The soundscape moves gently between cinematic swells and soft, rhythmic pulses — echoing the cold light of Arctic mornings and the grace of underwater encounters.
